result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Gillaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James L Gillaum is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James L Gillaum was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L Gillaum

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/30/22 sent electronically to DCJ

IN CUSTODY 
8:45 AM Defendant James L Gillaum in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for James L Gillaum.  Attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM repeater enhancer on count 1
On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 2   . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 8 months  in Dane County Jail, with Huber;

-Days credit for time served:  198 days
-Days credit to jail: 198 days
-Deemed served

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved


-DNA on file


-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Court accepts Request for Substitution of Judge prior to going to arraignment.  

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Being reassigned

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:58 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  ADA Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Law Enforcement S.K. duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - brief argument, Rebuttal by the State; Ct binds case over; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:24 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requested setover due to unavailability of witness.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:27 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE wants atty.  CT advises DE of rt to atty & refers to SPD f/w.  CT finds good cause to waive time limits.  Bail cont'd; set STC in 3 weeks. DE given notice in hand.
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BOF. 
- Defendant shall not be on Tree Ln. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
